intro: Calylophus hartwegii subsp. filifolia, commonly known as the filifoliate calylophus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and harsh climates.
